text: Panopea glycimeris is a species of large marine bivalve mollusc in the family Hiatellidae.BiolibWoRMS The fossil record of this species dates back to the Miocene of Italy (age range: 23.03 to 7.246 million years ago).Fossilworks ==Description== Shells of Panopea glycimeris can reach a size of .Conchology The two valves are similars and have a rusty appearance. The diameter of the siphonal apertures ranges between 5 and 7 cm. ==Distribution== This species can be found in the Mediterranean Sea and in the Northwestern coast of Africa, on sand bottom at depths of 10 to 100 m. It is actually rare in the Mediterranean Sea.Gianfranco SCOTTI, Salvino ANTIOCO, Franco ANDALORO and Renato CHEMELLO Finding of a living population of Panopea glycimeris (Von Born, 1778) (Bivalvia; Hiatellidae) in Eastern Sicily (Mediterranean Sea)World Wide Mollusc DatabaseP.
